intro: Anil hirta, commonly known as Indian madder, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to regions of southern and eastern Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. The roots of Anil hirta contain a red dye called alizarin, which has been historically used in natural dyeing processes.
